properties.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 11 at 11:48AM PST until January 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph
possible. Gusts over 70 mph possible in wind prone areas such as
Washoe Valley and the west side of the Carson Valley.

* WHERE...Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area, including Highway
395 communities.

* WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees, fences, and
power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be
hazardous, especially for high profile vehicles. Severe
turbulence for aviation.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A period of light snowfall is forecast
early Tuesday morning for the Reno and Carson City areas. This
combined with the strong winds could make the Tuesday morning
commute challenging with delays possible.
properties.instruction:
Prepare by securing loose outdoor items such as patio furniture,
holiday decorations (if you still really have those out), and
trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items
away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure
you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare
batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
